alert.note: Alert for Crowley (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 07 at 2:02PM MDT until August 07 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Crowley County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 300 PM MDT. * At 201 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing a tornado were located along a line extending from 14 miles south of Forder to 12 miles north of Sugar City, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Expect damage to mobile homes, roofs, and vehicles. * These tornadic storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Crowley County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
